revised_title: The Germicidal Properties of Chloramines and Their Mode of Action
tldr: The authors studied the antiseptic properties of substances in the Chloramine group, focusing on hypochlorites. They discovered that the germicidal action of hypochlorites is due to chemical reactions with proteins in microorganisms. The formation of substances containing halogen linked to nitrogen, such as chloramines, plays a significant role in their germicidal properties. The authors also investigated various types of chloramines and their reactions with amino-acids, proteins, and other substances, leading to the development of new antiseptic compounds like Chloramine-T.
